item.title: Social Media is a lot like Sex
item.description: Statistic sources: slide 3, 4,5 http://benterry.com/social-media-stats-2012/ slide 9 http://www.comscoredatamine.com/2012/01/people-spent-6-7-billion-hours-on-social-networks-in-october/ slide 10 http://www.insidefacebook.com/2009/07/02/facebook-now-growing-by-over-700000-users-a-day-updated-engagement-stats/ slide 11 http://www.mindjumpers.com/blog/2012/01/the-sharing-avalanche-infographic/ slide 12 http://asmarterplanet.com/blog/2012/10/redfining-commerce-in-the-age-of-the-consumer.html slide 14 http://www.comscoredatamine.com/2012/01/people-spent-6-7-billion-hours-on-social-networks-in-october/ slide 15 http://blog.nielsen.com/nielsenwire/online_mobile/august-2011-top-us-web-brands/ slide 17 http://marriage.about.com/cs/sexualstatistics/a/sexstatistics.htm slide 18 http://abcnews.go.com/images/Politics/959a1AmericanSexSurvey.pdf slide 19 http://www.chicagobooth.edu/newsmedia/releases/2012-01-27.aspx slide 21 http://mashable.com/2012/06/14/social-media-real-world-infographic/ slide 22 http://www.mindjumpers.com/blog/2012/05/time-spend-online/ slide 23 http://mashable.com/2012/06/14/social-media-real-world-infographic/ slide 24 http://mashable.com/2012/06/14/social-media-real-world-infographic/ slide 42 http://www.socialnomics.net/2012/08/28/3-shocking-social-media-stats-that-will-amp-up-your-marketing/ slide 44 http://www.socialnomics.net/2012/08/28/3-shocking-social-media-stats-that-will-amp-up-your-marketing/ slide 46 http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/35-percent-of-us-businesses-have-used-social-media-to-win-new-business-97931444.html

item.title: The Role of Mobile in Hurricane Sandy
item.description: This presentation looks at the role mobile technology – devices, apps, social networks, cameras and messaging – played in people’s lives as they prepared for, combated and began to recover from Hurricane Sandy.
item.content:encoded: This presentation looks at the role mobile technology – devices, apps, social networks, cameras and messaging – played in people’s lives as they prepared for, combated and began to recover from Hurricane Sandy.

item.title: Learning2learn
item.description: Let’s talk about LEARNING, not technology! What are some cultural shifts in our fast changing world, that have an impact on our own learning as educators? How can we start thinking differently about learning? Thank you to Will Richardson for his thought provoking "3 Steps to Start Thinking Differently About Learning"( learning.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/10/25/guest-post-three-starting-points-for-thinking-differently-about-learning/) , Alec Couros for his 5 Answers to Challenges of Teaching & Learning in the 21st Century" (slideshare.net/courosa/taking-on-the-challenge-of-21st-century-teaching-learning) and Steve Hargadon for his thoughts of "You First", which makes so much sense.
item.content:encoded: Let’s talk about LEARNING, not technology! What are some cultural shifts in our fast changing world, that have an impact on our own learning as educators? How can we start thinking differently about learning? Thank you to Will Richardson for his thought provoking "3 Steps to Start Thinking Differently About Learning"( learning.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/10/25/guest-post-three-starting-points-for-thinking-differently-about-learning/) , Alec Couros for his 5 Answers to Challenges of Teaching & Learning in the 21st Century" (slideshare.net/courosa/taking-on-the-challenge-of-21st-century-teaching-learning) and Steve Hargadon for his thoughts of "You First", which makes so much sense.
item.author: langwitches@slideshare.net(langwitches)

media:content.media:title: Learning2learn
media:content.media:description:
Let's talk about LEARNING, not technology! What are some cultural shifts in our fast changing world, that have an impact on our own learning as educators? How can we start thinking differently about learning?
Thank you to Will Richardson for his thought provoking "3 Steps to Start Thinking Differently About Learning"( learning.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/10/25/guest-post-three-starting-points-for-thinking-differently-about-learning/) , Alec Couros for his 5 Answers to Challenges of Teaching & Learning in the 21st Century" (slideshare.net/courosa/taking-on-the-challenge-of-21st-century-teaching-learning) and Steve Hargadon for his thoughts of "You First", which makes so much sense.
media:content.media:text: Let’s talk about LEARNING, not technology! What are some cultural shifts in our fast changing world, that have an impact on our own learning as educators? How can we start thinking differently about learning? Thank you to Will Richardson for his thought provoking "3 Steps to Start Thinking Differently About Learning"( learning.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/10/25/guest-post-three-starting-points-for-thinking-differently-about-learning/) , Alec Couros for his 5 Answers to Challenges of Teaching & Learning in the 21st Century" (slideshare.net/courosa/taking-on-the-challenge-of-21st-century-teaching-learning) and Steve Hargadon for his thoughts of "You First", which makes so much sense.

item.slideshare:embed: Learning2learn from Silvia Rosenthal Tolisano

item.title: Insights from Anne Fisher, Columnist at Fortune
item.description: 10 Inspirational Moments from Anne Fisher 1. The top 10 job profiles all require an engineering skill set. 2. Employers lean towards hiring people already employed. 3. Work environments that value ideas, recognize achievement and provide continual feedback, dramatically improve retention. 4. An organization is as good as the quality of conversations taking place in the hall ways. 5. As a manager, be clear on what inspires your associates and align their responsibilities with their strengths. 6. Money is less of a motivator than challenge and appreciation. 7. Exceptional sales and marketing people are recession proof. 8. To attract the best talent, entrepreneurs focus only what they can do that bigger companies aren’t able or willing to do. 9. Keep your job in perspective - never let it totally occupy your life, develop other interests. 10.To make a lasting first impression, be clear on what the job requires and tell the employer why you’re the best person for the job. Best Advice: Take your work seriously, but not yourself.
item.content:encoded: 10 Inspirational Moments from Anne Fisher 1. The top 10 job profiles all require an engineering skill set. 2. Employers lean towards hiring people already employed. 3. Work environments that value ideas, recognize achievement and provide continual feedback, dramatically improve retention. 4. An organization is as good as the quality of conversations taking place in the hall ways. 5. As a manager, be clear on what inspires your associates and align their responsibilities with their strengths. 6. Money is less of a motivator than challenge and appreciation. 7. Exceptional sales and marketing people are recession proof. 8. To attract the best talent, entrepreneurs focus only what they can do that bigger companies aren’t able or willing to do. 9. Keep your job in perspective - never let it totally occupy your life, develop other interests. 10.To make a lasting first impression, be clear on what the job requires and tell the employer why you’re the best person for the job. Best Advice: Take your work seriously, but not yourself.
item.author: InspirationalMoments@slideshare.net(InspirationalMoments)

media:content.media:title: Insights from Anne Fisher, Columnist at Fortune
media:content.media:description:
10 Inspirational Moments from Anne Fisher 1. The top 10 job profiles all require an engineering skill set. 2. Employers lean towards hiring people already employed. 3. Work environments that value ideas, recognize achievement and provide continual feedback, dramatically improve retention. 4. An organization is as good as the quality of conversations taking place in the hall ways. 5. As a manager, be clear on what inspires your associates and align their responsibilities with their strengths. 6. Money is less of a motivator than challenge and appreciation. 7. Exceptional sales and marketing people are recession proof. 8. To attract the best talent, entrepreneurs focus only what they can do that bigger companies aren't able or willing to do. 9. Keep your job in perspective - never let it totally occupy your life, develop other interests. 10.To make a lasting first impression, be clear on what the job requires and tell the employer why you're the best person for the job.
Best Advice: Take your work seriously, but not yourself.
media:content.media:text: 10 Inspirational Moments from Anne Fisher 1. The top 10 job profiles all require an engineering skill set. 2. Employers lean towards hiring people already employed. 3. Work environments that value ideas, recognize achievement and provide continual feedback, dramatically improve retention. 4. An organization is as good as the quality of conversations taking place in the hall ways. 5. As a manager, be clear on what inspires your associates and align their responsibilities with their strengths. 6. Money is less of a motivator than challenge and appreciation. 7. Exceptional sales and marketing people are recession proof. 8. To attract the best talent, entrepreneurs focus only what they can do that bigger companies aren’t able or willing to do. 9. Keep your job in perspective - never let it totally occupy your life, develop other interests. 10.To make a lasting first impression, be clear on what the job requires and tell the employer why you’re the best person for the job. Best Advice: Take your work seriously, but not yourself.

item.title: OMG. HE HAS A BOMB!
item.description: Credits to @jessedee for introducing me to visual resumes and inspiring my work in so many ways, and my love Sharon for pushing me into realizing my ideas and living my creativity. Without you, this presentation would not exist. Without you, I would not be running around with a smile on my face - every day. Feel free to share, download, twitter about it, etc. and help me to find my dream job. Thank you so much for your help and support!
